clinical_study.brief_title: A Trial of Ciclesonide in Adults With Mild COVID-19
clinical_study.official_title: A Trial of Ciclesonide Alone or in Combination With Hydroxychloroquine for Adults With Mild COVID-19

brief_summary.textblock:
According to In vitro studies, ciclesonide showed good antiviral activity against severe
      acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2). Although some cases were reported for
      the clinical effectiveness of ciclesonide in the treatment of COVID-19, there is no clinical
      trial to evaluate the antiviral effect on the reduction of viral load in patients with
      COVID-19. In this study, we aimed to investigate whether ciclesonide alone or in combination
      with hydroxychloroquine could eradicate SARS-CoV-2 from respiratory tract earlier in patients
      with mild COVID-19.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: This multicenter study is an open-labelled, randomized clinical trial for 1:1:1 ratio of ciclesonide, ciclesonide plus hydroxychloroquine or control arm

primary_outcome.measure: Rate of SARS-CoV-2 eradication at day 14 from study enrollment

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of SARS-CoV-2 eradication at day 7 from study enrollment
Viral load area-under-the-curve (AUC) reduction versus control

secondary_outcome.description: Resolution of all systemic and respiratory symptoms for ≥2 consecutive days
ICU admission, mechanical ventilation or death

other_outcome.measure: Safety and tolerability of study drug
other_outcome.description: Number of adverse events, proportion of early discontinuance

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Patients with mild COVID-19 (NEWS scoring system 0-4)

          -  Patient within 7 days from symptom onset or Patient within 48 hous after laboratory
             diagnosis (SARS-CoV-2 RT-PCR)

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Unable to take oral medication

          -  Unable to use inhaler

          -  Pregnancy or breast feeding

          -  Immunocompromising conditions

          -  Moderate/severe renal dysfunction : creatinine clearance (CCL) < 30 mL/min

          -  Moderate/severe liver dysfunction: AST or ALT > 5 times upper normal limit

          -  Asthma or chronic obstructive lung disease
